page.title: 07Saving our Dunes - Project
page.content: We went to the dunes to plant marram grass with Mr.Lewis.We left school at 1.25pm.We walked in pairs down the track and along by the Mobil Garage. Then we met Mr.Lewis by the life guard hut.He had a land rover.We asked him many questions.We are planting because the dunes are receding and the blown sand is causing problems in the village.When there is no grass the sand blows away.This community project has been going for five years.The MSC are helping to move the marram grass from the top of the dunes.It is one of the few plants which grows in sand. They have very long roots of up to 15m in length.The leaves curl when it is hot to trap the moisture and make it run down to the roots.You use a special spade and work in pairs.A West Briton photographer took photos of us. We were in the local newspaper.
